alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 27 at 8:02PM CDT until March 27 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern East Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... North Central Iberville Parish in southeastern Louisiana... West Baton Rouge Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1115 PM CDT. * At 802 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Baton Rouge, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Addis, Brusly, Rosedale, Grosse Tete, Gardere, Merrydale, Westminster, Brownfields, Inniswold, Village St. George, Shenandoah, Old Jefferson and Baton Rouge Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 140 and 164. Interstate 12 between mile markers 1 and 7. Interstate 110 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Iberville; West Baton Rouge
